_header: This night before the dawing clear
Title(s): ‘How Dunbar wes desyred to be ane freir’
Subjects: friars, criticism/satire of; Francis of Assisi, saint; dream visions
_description: William Dunbar, ‘How Dunbar wes desyred to be ane freir’ — ten 5-line stanzas

CULLl510.First Lines:
This nycht befoir þe dawing cleirMe thocht sanct francis did
                    to me appeir…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…With him me thocht all þe hous end he tukeAnd I awuke as
                    wy þat wes in weir

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
This nycht befoir þe dawing cleirMe thocht sant francis did to
                    me appeir…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…with him me thocht all þe hous end he tukeAnd I awuke as
                    wy þat wes in weir
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.404-5.

Banna.First Lines:
This nycht befoir the dawing cleirMe thocht sanct francis did to me
                    appeir…
Banna.Last Lines:
…With him me thocht all the houshend he towkand I Awoik as wy
                    þat wes in weir
Banna.Attributed Title: ffollowis how dumbar wes desyrd to be ane freir (f. 115)
